results.title: A Tale of Two Cities
results.creator_credit: Jack Conway and David O. Selznick
results.brief_description: Based on Charles Dickens great novel, “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of turbulent times - the French revolution, recreated in breathtaking scale and painstaking detail. And it is a timeless tale - the story of two men in love with the same woman. Ronald Colman stars in what is perceived as the best role he ever played. “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of romance and revolution, politics and passion, but most of all it is a true classic for all time.

results.title: Madame Bovary
results.brief_description: Jennifer Jones, Van Heflin and Louis Jourdan star in the masterpiece of French literature that scandalised the 19th Century. Gustave Flaubert’s Madame Bovary is a beautiful film and a candid portrait of a woman in revolt against conventional society.

results.title: Little Women
results.brief_description: One of the most enduring of the Hollywood movie classics, “Little Women” is based on Louisa May Alcott’s beloved novel. It is the story of four sisters who grow up together in Massachusetts during the Civil War. We enter their world to share their joys and sorrows as they become the “little women” that their father so proudly calls them. Stars Katherine Hepburn, Douglas Montgomery, Paul Lukas, Joan Bennett, Frances Dee and Jean Parker.

results.title: Pride and prejudice
results.creator_credit: Robert J Kern, Robert Z Leonard, Hunt Stromberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Five marriageable daughters! What’s a mother to do? What’s a father to do? What are we to do? Laugh, cry and become totally entranced by “Pride and Prejudice”, Jane Austen’s classic comedy of manners. Adapted for the screen by Aldous Huxley, this energetic film stars Greer Garson and Laurence Olivier. Also starring are Edmund Gwenn, Mary Boland, Maureen O’Sullivan and Ann Rutherford. The beautiful costumes are by renown designer Adrian.

results.title: David Copperfield
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, David O. Selznick and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: David Copperfield enjoys an idyllic life with his gentle mother and his loving nurse, Peggotty. Tragedy strikes when Mr Murdstone, a monster of cruelty, weds David’s mother and drives her to an early grave. His adventures from this time introduce us to every stratum of colourful Victorian society. Since its debut in 1935, “David Copperfield” has been acclaimed for its handpicked cast, one that remains unsurpassed to this day. Stars W.C. Fields, Maureen O’Sullivan, Lionel Barrymore, Freddie Bartholomew, May Oliver, Basil Rathbone and over 65 star cast players. Based on the novel by Charles Dickens. Rated: G

results.title: Brigadoon
results.brief_description: The magical world of Brigadoon casts a spell in this exuberant Scottish village that rises out of the Highland mists for just one day in every century. Gene Kelly and Van Johnson star as two jaded New Yorkers who come to Scotland on a hunting expedition and stumble upon the elusive 18th century village. There Kelly falls in love with Brigadoon’s prettiest lass, Fiona, played by Cyd Charisse, and he must decide whether to stay with her forever or return to civilisation. Rating: G

results.title: Monterey pop
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, Lou Adler and John Phillips
results.brief_description: In June 1967, the Mamas and the Papas hosted a three day Pop Festival in Monterey, California. D.A. Pennebaker’s outstanding film is a record of extraordinary musicians and extraordinary insight into an era. This is the 60’s in celebration, exploding with new voices and optimistic energy. Performing artists include Janis Joplin, Otis Redding, Jimi Hendrix, Jefferson Airplane, Simon and Garfunkel, Scott McKenzie, Eric Burdon and the Animals, Canned Heat and The Who.

results.title: Show Boat
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The 1951 MGM film of the great stage musical, based on the 1926 novel by Edna Ferber, is a charming, beautiful entertainment with an endearing cast, including Kathryn Grayson as Magnolia, Howard Keel as the gambler, Gaylord Ravenal, and Ava Gardner, nominated for an Academy Award, as the tragic Julie Laverne.

results.title: They're a weird mob
results.brief_description: ‘They’re a Weird Mob’ is about Sydney, Australia in 1965 - a sprawling, growing city of three million people - and what people! Easy going, down-to-earth and hilariously funny - a very weird mob. Into this city arrives innocent Italian migrant, Nino Culotta. The adventures of Nino fitting in with the ‘weird mob’, learning their ways and outlandish language are shown in this Australian comedy classic. The film was carefully marketed as an ‘Australian’ production, despite Powell’s presence as producer-director, his British director of photography, and a screenplay by his regular collaborator in England, Emeric Pressburger (using the pseudonym Richard Imrie). Based on the book by Nino Culotta (John O’Grady). Cast includes Walter Cohiari, Clare Dunne, Chips Rafferty, Ed Devereaux, John Meillion and Tony Bonner.

results.title: The Navigator: A Medieval Odyssey
results.creator_credit: Vincent Ward, Gary Hannam, John Maynard, New Zealand Film Commission and Arenafilm
results.brief_description: The navigator is remarkable because of its absorbing story that links medieval fears and fortunes to our times, while confirming director Vincent Ward as an original talent. It is Cumbria 1348, the year of the Black Death. A young visionary tells his fellow miners that their community may survive the plague if they place a spire on a distant cathedral before dawn. So, from their grim, snowbound Lake District, they dig down an old mine-shaft to the other side of the world, emerging in an Eastman-coloured present day Auckland, New Zealand. Cast includes Bruce Lyons, Chris Haywood and Hamish McFarlane.
